pages.title: Of Soil and Sky
pages.text: I first stepped onto this land with nothing but the crunch of dirt beneath my boots and the breeze curling through the leaves above. It felt like the world held its breath, just for a moment, to see if I would stay.There is a stillness here—not empty, but *listening*.

pages.title: The Shape of Shelter
pages.text: $(br)A roof is more than wood and nails. It’s a promise to yourself.Even the smallest lean-to feels like a fortress when you build it with your own two hands.Walls don’t need to be perfect, just true. Find the heart of your shelter. Let it beat with warmth.

pages.title: The Language of Leaves
pages.text: $(br)The trees whisper if you pay attention. Their leaves change tone with the seasons, with the soil, with the winds.A sharp green for energy, a tired brown for change. Some glow golden not to fade, but to shine one last time.Listen. They will guide you.

pages.title: Underfoot, Unseen
pages.text: $(br)Roots hold secrets. Not just water and minerals, but stories. Old ones.I once unearthed a stone carved with symbols under a birch. Perhaps from another traveler like me. Or a warning. Or a blessing.The soil remembers. Even when we do not.

pages.title: Harvests Small and Sweet
pages.text: $(br)I found my first berries by accident—my hands stained purple for days.Not every harvest needs to be grand. Sometimes, it’s a single apple. A mushroom after rain. A handful of grain shared with a friend.It’s not what you gather. It’s how you savor it.

pages.title: Hands in Harmony
pages.text: $(br)The rhythm of shaping wood, of placing stone—it hums like music.My hands ache at day’s end, but my heart feels light. When you craft with care, the world responds in kind.

pages.title: Nights That Hold You
pages.text: $(br)Nights used to scare me. The silence. The dark.But then I learned to light candles. To build fires. To wrap myself in warmth.Now the night feels like a blanket—not to trap me, but to tuck me in. There’s beauty in the quiet.

pages.title: Pages Yet to Grow
pages.text: $(br)My story isn't finished. Neither is yours.If you’ve read this far, then your roots are planted too. *Let them grow.*
